page.title: 12KIBLESTONE SCOUT CAMP
page.content: Land let to the Scouts from 1927 by Ronald Copeland a Pottery manufacturer. Formerly the site of Kibblestone Hall but also extending across the road and down to the A.51 trunk road. In 1960 the Scouts purchased the site which included Camp and Training Centre, Wetmore Mill and the Mill House. At this time a full time Warden was installed, Mr. Donald Rowe, and in 1985 still does this job. The Stoke District Scouts own and administer the site and have Scouts Guides and International visitors to the site. It is beautifully wooded with superb shows of Daffodils and Bluebells.There is an enormous variety of trees encouraged by Mr. C. Marshall Amor. Many camping activities, absailing on sandstone cliffs and a plunge pool for swimming are all on site.
